I.name: Gift of the Drowned Ones
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Pyke's''' {{sti|health|{{as|'''maximum''' health}}}} cannot increase except through [[Growth#Increasing_Statistics|growth (per level)]], instead he gains{{ft|{{sti|{{as|1 '''bonus''' attack damage}}}} {{as|per 14 '''bonus''' health}}.|{{as|({{fd|7.143}}% '''bonus''' health)}} {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}}.}}
{{sbc|Innate:}} '''Pyke''' gains {{as|1 '''bonus''' movement speed}} while in the river.

{{sbc|Innate:}} '''Pyke''' stores 9% {{as|(+ {{fd|0.2}}% per 1 Lethality)}} of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} he takes from enemy {{tip|champions}} as [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] on his [[health bar]], increased to 40% {{as|(+ {{fd|0.4}}% per 1 Lethality)}} while there are two or more {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy champions nearby. He can store up to 80 {{as|(+ 800% '''bonus''' AD)}} [[Health#Grey health|grey health]], with an upper cap of {{as|60% of his '''maximum''' health}}.
When '''Pyke''' is not {{tip|sight|visible}} to enemies, he rapidly consumes his [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] to {{tip|heal}} for the same amount.
I.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Pyke's maximum health cannot increase except through Growth#Increasing_Statistics, instead he gains
Innate: Pyke gains 1 bonus movement speed while in the river.
Innate: Pyke stores 9% (+ 0.2% per 1 Lethality) of the post-mitigation damage he takes from enemy champions as Health#Grey health on his health bar, increased to 40% (+ 0.4% per 1 Lethality) while there are two or more visible enemy champions nearby. He can store up to 80 (+ 800% bonus AD) Health#Grey health, with an upper cap of 60% of his maximum health.
When Pyke is not visible to enemies, he rapidly consumes his Health#Grey health to heal for the same amount.
I.notes:
* Game elements that increase health based on the champion's health (e.g {{ri|Overgrowth}}) will increase the health before getting converted by ''Gift of the Drowned Ones'', thus granting increased {{as|bonus AD}}.
* {{ii|Spirit Visage}} and {{tip|Grievous Wounds}} take effect after ''Gift of the Drowned Ones's'' healing cap.
*'''Pyke's''' ''grey health'' does not have a time limit, and will stay on his {{as|health bar}} until '''Pyke''' leaves enemy vision or dies.
* Since '''Pyke's''' '''maximum''' health cannot be increased, ''Gift of the Drowned Ones'' reaches the upper cap of {{as|60% of '''maximum''' health}} at {{pp|(0.6*({{ccd|Pyke|hp_base}}+{{ccd|Pyke|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))-80)/8|color=ad}} {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}.
* {{tip|Untargetable}} champions count towards '''Pyke's''' modified ''grey health'' storing.
{{Gift of the Drowned Ones lethality calculations}}
* Amount of attack damage granted from list of items that grants health, converted with ''Gift of the Drowned Ones'':

{{Item stat table|pykehealth}}

Q.name: Bone Skewer
Q.target_range: {{tip|er|icononly = true}} {{pp|type=channel time|400;400 to 1100 for 7|0;0.4 to 1|formula=400+(116.67 per 0.1 seconds, starting at 0.4 seconds). ''This is capped at 1 second.''}}
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Pyke''' {{tip|channel|charges}} while being {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 20% for up to 3 seconds to increase ''Bone Skewer's'' {{sti|range}} over the first second of the channel. ''Bone Skewer'' can be recast at any time within the duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Pyke''' {{tip|projectile|hurls}} his harpoon in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy hit, {{tip|airborne|pulling}} them {{tt|towards his direction|The pull can fling an enemy behind Pyke if the harpoon hits at close range}}, during which they are also {{tip|standard sight|revealed}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 90% for 1 second.

Releasing the ability within {{fd|0.4}} seconds causes '''Pyke''' to instead thrust his blade in the target direction, dealing the same damage to the closest enemy {{tip|champion}}, or closest enemy otherwise.

If the charge is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}} or completes without reactivation, ''Bone Skewer'' is cancelled and the ability is put on {{sti|cd|full}} cooldown but refunds {{sti|mana|{{as|75% of the mana cost}}}}. ''Bone Skewer's'' {{as|mana cost}} is refunded if it hits an enemy {{tip|champion}}.
Q.descriptionHtml:
Active: Pyke charges while being slowed by 20% for up to 3 seconds to increase Bone Skewer's range over the first second of the channel. Bone Skewer can be recast at any time within the duration.
Recast: Pyke hurls his harpoon in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy hit, pulling them towards his direction, during which they are also revealed, and slowing them by 90% for 1 second.
Releasing the ability within 0.4 seconds causes Pyke to instead thrust his blade in the target direction, dealing the same damage to the closest enemy champion, or closest enemy otherwise.
If the charge is interrupted or completes without reactivation, Bone Skewer is cancelled and the ability is put on full cooldown but refunds 75% of the mana cost. Bone Skewer's mana cost is refunded if it hits an enemy champion.

W.name: Ghostwater Dive
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Pyke''' submerges into water, entering {{tip|camouflage}} for 5 seconds and gaining {{as|40%|ms}} {{as|(+ {{fd|1.5}}% per 1 Lethality)}} {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over the duration. Enemy champions within 1500 units of '''Pyke''' are alerted of his presence and whether he can execute them with ''{{ai|Death from Below|Pyke}}''.
Attacking or casting abilities ends ''Ghostwater Dive'' immediately.
W.descriptionHtml:
Active: Pyke submerges into water, entering camouflage for 5 seconds and gaining 40% (+ 1.5% per 1 Lethality) bonus movement speed that decays over the duration. Enemy champions within 1500 units of Pyke are alerted of his presence and whether he can execute them with Pyke's Death from Below.
Attacking or casting abilities ends Ghostwater Dive immediately.
W.notes:
* When an enemy is alerted, sharks will circle underneath their feet while a sound will be played to them that changes based on health threshold.
{{Ghostwater Dive lethality calculations}}

E.name: Phantom Undertow
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Pyke''' {{tip|dash|dashes}} a fixed distance in the target direction, leaving behind a ''Phantom''.

After a 1-second delay, the ''Phantom'' homes back to '''Pyke''' to {{tip|stun}} enemies around it and those it passes through along the way for {{fd|1.25}} {{as|(+ {{fd|0.1}} per 10 Lethality)}} seconds. Enemy {{tip|champions}} hit also take {{as|physical damage}}.
E.descriptionHtml:
Active: Pyke dashes a fixed distance in the target direction, leaving behind a Phantom.
After a 1-second delay, the Phantom homes back to Pyke to stun enemies around it and those it passes through along the way for 1.25 (+ 0.1 per 10 Lethality) seconds. Enemy champions hit also take physical damage.

R.name: Death from Below
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Pyke''' marks the target location with an ''X'' before striking it, {{ccs|{{tip|execute|executing|noimg=true}}|true}} enemy {{tip|champions}} within the area that are below {{as|{{pp|250;290;330;370;400;430;450;470;490;510;530;540;550|6 to 18}}|health}} {{as|(+ 80% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{fd|1.5}} per 1 Lethality)}} {{sti|{{as|health}}}}. Other enemies hit and enemy champions above the threshold are instead dealt{{ft|50% of the amount as {{as|physical damage}}.|{{as|{{pp|125;145;165;185;200;215;225;235;245;255;265;270;275|6 to 18}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ 40% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{fd|0.75}} per 1 Lethality)}} {{as|physical damage}}.}}

If ''Death from Below'' hits an enemy {{tip|champion}} or at least one is [[death|killed]] inside the ''X'' by an ally, '''Pyke''' will {{tip|blink}} to the center of the ''X''. For the latter case '''Pyke''' also gains the ability to recast within 20 seconds at no cost.

Each successful ''execution'' grants one {{ii|'Your Cut'}} to the last assisting ally, instead of its natural [[assist]] {{g|gold}}. In addition, each enemy champion killed inside the ''X'' by an ally during ''Death from Below's'' cast time grants '''Pyke''' one {{ii|'Your Cut'}}.
R.descriptionHtml:
Active: Pyke marks the target location with an X before striking it, executing / true">Unknown value: ccs / executing / true enemy champions within the area that are below 6 to 18 ‒ undefined (+ 80% bonus AD) (+ 1.5 per 1 Lethality) health. Other enemies hit and enemy champions above the threshold are instead dealt
If Death from Below hits an enemy champion or at least one is death inside the X by an ally, Pyke will blink to the center of the X. For the latter case Pyke also gains the ability to recast within 20 seconds at no cost.
Each successful execution grants one 'Your Cut' to the last assisting ally, instead of its natural assist gold. In addition, each enemy champion killed inside the X by an ally during Death from Below's cast time grants Pyke one 'Your Cut'.
R.notes:
* Applies {{tip|raw damage}} to executed targets and {{tip|area damage}} to targets above the threshold.
* {{ii|'Your Cut'}} will be granted if enemy champions 
* ''Death from Below'' cannot execute {{tip|clone|clones}}. They are always dealt 50% {{as|physical damage}}.
* Only the target's current health will count as '''Pyke's''' damage in post-game statistics and {{sti|spell vamp}} healing if executed.
** If the target's current health is less than 50% of the {{tt|post-mitigation|after damage modifiers}} non-executing damage, '''Pyke''' will heal less from spell vamp.
* If the target is in a {{tip|zombie state}} or does not enter the {{tip|death}} state, ''Death from Below'' does not grant {{ii|'Your Cut'}} nor the recast.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} does not prevent '''Pyke''' from {{tip|blink|blinking}}.
* If an enemy champion dies inside the ''X'' during ''Death from Below's'' cast time, '''Pyke''' will be shown as having received an assist in the kill feed, but this will not trigger {{tip|takedown}} effects.
* ''Death from Below'' cannot be {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}; '''Pyke''' will always appear at the target location if enemy champions are caught inside the ''X'' even if he is moved (e.g. by being {{tip|airborne|displaced}}) during the cast time.
** The only exception is if he is being {{tip|suppression|suppressed}}, in which case he will not {{tip|blink}}.
{{Death from Below lethality calculations}}
